title: Going To: Future Plans
description: Слушайте о будущих планах с конструкцией going to.

tasks.audioText: I have my suitcase ready. I am going to travel to Italy next week.
tasks.transcript: I am going to travel to Italy next week.

options.text: The person plans to visit Italy soon.
The person travelled to Italy last week.
The person is in Italy right now.
The person does not want to travel.

tasks.explanation: 'Am going to travel' shows a future plan that is already decided.

tasks.audioText: Look at those dark clouds! It is going to rain soon.
tasks.transcript: It is going to rain soon.

options.text: It rained yesterday.
Rain will probably start very soon.
The weather is sunny and warm.
It is raining right now.

tasks.explanation: 'Is going to rain' predicts something based on what we can see now.

tasks.audioText: My sister finished university. She is going to start a new job in September.
tasks.transcript: She is going to start a new job in September.

options.text: She started working last September.
She does not want a job.
She plans to begin working in September.
She is working at her job right now.

tasks.explanation: 'Is going to start' means she has a plan for the future.

tasks.audioText: We saved enough money this year. We are going to buy a new car.
tasks.transcript: We are going to buy a new car.

options.text: They bought a car last year.
They plan to purchase a new car.
They are selling their car.
They don't have enough money.

tasks.explanation: 'Are going to buy' means they have decided to buy a car.

tasks.audioText: Tom is studying very hard. He is going to pass his exam.
tasks.transcript: He is going to pass his exam.

options.text: Tom failed the exam.
Tom took the exam yesterday.
Tom will probably succeed in the exam.
Tom stopped studying.

tasks.explanation: 'Is going to pass' is a prediction based on evidence — he studies hard.

tasks.audioText: I feel sick today. I am going to see the doctor this afternoon.
tasks.transcript: I am going to see the doctor this afternoon.

options.text: The person plans to visit the doctor today.
The person saw the doctor yesterday.
The person feels fine now.
The doctor is not available today.

tasks.explanation: 'Am going to see' shows a planned visit to the doctor.

tasks.audioText: We are tired of the city noise. We are going to move to the countryside.
tasks.transcript: We are going to move to the countryside.

options.text: They already live in the countryside.
They plan to move out of the city.
They are going to stay in the city.
They moved to the city last year.

tasks.explanation: 'Are going to move' means they plan to change where they live.

tasks.audioText: Maria loves animals. She is going to volunteer at the animal shelter.
tasks.transcript: She is going to volunteer at the animal shelter.

options.text: Maria plans to help at the animal shelter.
Maria adopted an animal last week.
Maria does not like animals.
The shelter is permanently closed.

tasks.explanation: 'Is going to volunteer' means she has a plan to help there.

tasks.audioText: The kids are excited about Saturday. They are going to visit the zoo.
tasks.transcript: They are going to visit the zoo.

options.text: The kids went to the zoo yesterday.
The kids are at the zoo right now.
The kids plan to go to the zoo on Saturday.
The zoo is closed on Saturday.

tasks.explanation: 'Are going to visit' means a planned future trip.

tasks.audioText: I bought all the ingredients. I am going to cook dinner tonight.
tasks.transcript: I am going to cook dinner tonight.

options.text: The person cooked dinner last night.
The person plans to make dinner tonight.
The person is eating dinner now.
The person ordered food from a restaurant.

tasks.explanation: 'Am going to cook' means the person plans to prepare food tonight.

tasks.audioText: Our flat is too small now. We are going to look for a bigger one.
tasks.transcript: We are going to look for a bigger one.

options.text: They found a new flat already.
They like their small flat.
They plan to search for a larger flat.
They are moving out today.

tasks.explanation: 'Are going to look' means they intend to search in the future.

tasks.audioText: I got a gym membership last week. I am going to exercise every morning.
tasks.transcript: I am going to exercise every morning.

options.text: The person plans to work out each morning.
The person cancelled the gym membership.
The person exercises only at night.
The person exercised yesterday.

tasks.explanation: 'Am going to exercise' is a decided plan for the future.

tasks.audioText: My friend invited me. I am going to go to her party on Saturday.
tasks.transcript: I am going to go to her party on Saturday.

options.text: The person was at a party last Saturday.
The person plans to attend a party on Saturday.
The person will not go to the party.
The party is cancelled.

tasks.explanation: 'Am going to go' means a planned attendance at the party.

tasks.audioText: I found a great recipe online. I am going to try it this weekend.
tasks.transcript: I am going to try it this weekend.

options.text: The person tried the recipe last weekend.
The person does not like cooking.
The person plans to use the recipe this weekend.
The person lost the recipe.

tasks.explanation: 'Am going to try' means a plan to do something in the near future.

tasks.audioText: We talked about our vacation. We are going to fly to Thailand in December.
tasks.transcript: We are going to fly to Thailand in December.

options.text: They plan to visit Thailand in December.
They came back from Thailand.
They are in Thailand right now.
They are going to Japan in December.

tasks.explanation: 'Are going to fly' means they have a planned trip to Thailand.
